intro: Machaeranthera stenoloba, commonly known as the narrowleaf prairie coneflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, tubular yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open prairies and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions. Its narrow, linear leaves and distinctive coneflower structure make it a notable species in native plant gardens. Machaeranthera stenoloba plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly bees and butterflies, due to its nectar-rich flowers.
